entries.title: Elide Runtime Overview
entries.content: Elide is a high-performance polyglot runtime built on GraalVM 25.0.0 and the Truffle framework. It supports JavaScript, TypeScript, Python 3.11, Java JDK 24, Kotlin K2 v2.2.21, Ruby, WebAssembly, and LLVM. Key performance characteristics: ~20ms cold start (10x faster than Node.js), ~800K RPS on Linux, zero-serialization cross-language calls with <1ms overhead.

entries.title: Elide Fetch Handler Pattern
entries.content: The recommended HTTP pattern in Elide Beta11-rc1 is the Fetch Handler: export default async function fetch(req: Request): Promise<Response>. This pattern requires no imports and is native to the Elide runtime. The HTTP stack uses Netty for I/O and Micronaut for protocol handling.

entries.title: Elide Project Configuration
entries.content: Elide uses the Pkl language for type-safe project configuration via elide.pkl files. Basic structure: amends 'elide:project.pkl', name, description, entrypoint block, and dependencies block supporting npm, maven, and pypi packages.

entries.title: Essential Elide CLI Commands
entries.content: Core commands: elide run <script> (run script), elide serve --port N (start HTTP server), elide repl (interactive REPL), elide init (initialize project), elide install (install dependencies), elide add <package> (add dependency), elide build (build project), elide test (run tests). Advanced: elide native-image, elide mcp, elide lsp.

entries.title: Python Integration in Elide
entries.content: Elide supports Python 3.11 with zero-copy interop. Import Python modules with: const module = await import('module_name'). Python code runs on the same heap as JavaScript, enabling efficient data sharing without serialization.

entries.title: Java Integration in Elide
entries.content: Access Java classes from TypeScript using: const ClassName = Java.type('fully.qualified.ClassName'). Elide runs on GraalVM with JDK 24 support. Java objects are accessed directly on the shared heap without serialization overhead.

entries.title: WHIPLASH - Elide 2.0
entries.content: WHIPLASH is the Rust rewrite of Elide targeting: <10ms cold start, >1M RPS, <30MB memory baseline, <20MB binary size. Architecture includes crates: elide-core, elide-js, elide-http, elide-rpc, elide-runtime. Uses Cap'n Proto for protocol definitions.

entries.title: CORS Headers Pattern
entries.content: Standard CORS headers for Elide HTTP servers: { 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*', 'Access-Control-Allow-Methods': 'GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS', 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers': 'Content-Type, Authorization' }. Handle OPTIONS requests for preflight.

entries.title: Health Check Endpoint Pattern
entries.content: All Elide HTTP servers should implement a health check at /health returning: { status: 'healthy' } with Content-Type: application/json. This enables load balancer health monitoring and service discovery.

entries.title: Elide Showcase Ecosystem
entries.content: The elide-showcases repository contains 211+ demonstration projects covering: AI/ML (25+), Edge Computing (15+), Enterprise Platforms (20+), Data Processing (15+), API & Integration (20+), DevOps (10+), and Polyglot examples (15+). Top showcases: llm-inference-server, ai-agent-framework, graphql-federation.

entries.title: Elide Quiz Structure
entries.content: The Elide Quiz contains 500 questions across categories: Runtime & Core (100), CLI Commands (80), HTTP & Servers (80), Projects & Dependencies (60), Polyglot (50), Testing & Build (40), Beta11 Features (50), Advanced Topics (40). Thresholds: Pass 350+ (70%), Expert 425+ (85%), Master 475+ (95%).

entries.title: Elide Performance Benchmarks
entries.content: Elide performance on Linux: ~20ms cold start (10x faster than Node.js), ~800K requests per second, <1ms cross-language call overhead. Benchmarked by TechEmpower. GraalVM provides unified GC across all languages on shared heap.

entries.title: Module Export HTTP Pattern
entries.content: Alternative HTTP pattern: async function fetch(req: Request): Promise<Response> { ... }; export default { fetch }. This pattern wraps the fetch function in an object, useful when additional exports are needed from the module.

entries.title: NPM Dependencies in Elide
entries.content: Add npm dependencies in elide.pkl: dependencies { npm { 'package-name' = '^1.0.0' } }. Run 'elide install' to install. Note: For HTTP servers, prefer native Elide fetch handler over npm HTTP libraries for best performance.

entries.title: Streaming Responses in Elide
entries.content: Create streaming responses using ReadableStream: new Response(new ReadableStream({ start(controller) { controller.enqueue(data); controller.close(); } })). Useful for SSE, large file downloads, and real-time data.

entries.title: Error Handling Pattern
entries.content: Wrap fetch handler in try/catch: try { return new Response(...); } catch (error) { return new Response(JSON.stringify({ error: error.message }), { status: 500, headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }); }

entries.title: GraalVM Version
entries.content: Elide is built on GraalVM v25.0.0 with Truffle framework. This provides: JIT compilation across languages, ahead-of-time native image compilation, polyglot interoperability, and unified memory management.

entries.title: Native HTTP Advantage
entries.content: Elide's native HTTP using Netty + Micronaut outperforms npm-based HTTP libraries. The Fetch Handler pattern requires no imports and runs directly on the optimized runtime. For production performance, always prefer native HTTP over express, fastify, etc.

entries.title: Testing in Elide
entries.content: Run tests with 'elide test'. Write unit tests for pure functions, integration tests for HTTP endpoints. Test polyglot interactions explicitly. Elide supports standard testing patterns with built-in test runner.

entries.title: Cap'n Proto in WHIPLASH
entries.content: WHIPLASH uses Cap'n Proto for protocol definitions. Files: base.capnp (fundamental types: Timestamp, Duration, Error, Metadata), http.capnp (HttpRequest, HttpResponse, Header, HttpMethod). Provides efficient zero-copy serialization.
